title.narrative: Cameroon: Inclusive and Resilient Cities Development Project

description.narrative: The PDO is to improve urban management and access to infrastructure in selected urban areas, particularly for poor neighborhoods, and increase resilience to natural hazards and other eligible crises.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Urban Development and Housing (MINDUH)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Computerized financial and accounting system | Description :The Recipient shall install within the PCU, no laterthan three (3) months after the Effective date, a computerized financial and accounting system in a manner satisfactory to theAssociation. | Due Date :30-Aug-2019.

Finance Agreement :External auditors | Description :In order to ensure the timely carrying of the audits referred to in SectionII.B.3 of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement, the Recipient shall engage external auditors for the purpose, not later than six(6) months after the Effective date, in accordance with the provisions of Section III of Schedule 2. | Due Date :29-Nov-2019

Finance Agreement :Implementation contracts | Description :To facilitate the implementation of Parts A.1, B.1, B.2 and B.4 of theProject, no later than three (3) months after the Effective date, the Recipient, has, through MINHDU, executed implementationcontracts with each Beneficiary City in form and substance satisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :30-Aug-2019

Finance Agreement :PCU consultants | Description :The Recipient shall recruit, no later than three (3) months after the EffectiveDate, an internal auditor, a civil engineer, a municipal development specialist, an environmental specialist, a social developmentspecialist, and a monitoring and evaluation specialist, all with qualifications and terms of reference acceptable to theAssociation. | Due Date :30-Aug-2019.

Finance Agreement :Procurement staff | Description :The Recipient shall, no later than two (2) months after the Effective Date,train the procurement staff of the Project Coordination Unit in the use of the Association's procurement procedures in a mannersatisfactory to the Association. | Due Date :31-July-2019

title.narrative: CTDs that publish semi-annually the progress achieved on commitments made in their city contracts
Cities for which the urban database is updated regularly
Functional Neighborhood Development Committees were elected positions are occupied by at least (a) 30 % women and (b) 20% youth (number)
Area protected from a flodding event with a 10-year return period (ha)
Youth-led initiatives supported by the project, of which 40% led by women
People provided with improved urban living conditions - Female (RMS requirement)
Sludge deposed in the treatment plan in Ngombe (daily volume, m3 and % of capacity)
Sector land use plans developped and validated under the project
People provided with improved urban living conditions
Cities with improved livability, sustainability, and/or management
Beneficiaries that feel project investments reflected their needs (percentage, disaggregated by gender)
CTDs that achieve annual targets for the execution of the priority maintenance programs (PMP) (included in their city contracts)
Unplanned settlement area for which the defined upgrading plans have been implemented
Grievances registered related to delivery of project benefits that are actually addressed
Asset management system for road and drainage assets operational in Douala and Yaounde

target.value: Five year O&M plan implemented in all CA and updated
